docs.title: DNS
docs.text: Mihomo 通过 DNS 劫持进入 DNS 模块，使得来自 TUN、Redirect 或 TProxy 入站的流量可以将 IP 映射至对应的域名。

docs.title: 语法
docs.text:
mihomo 使用 yaml 作为配置文件格式

yaml 大小写敏感，使用缩进表示层级关系，缩进不允许使用 tab, 只允许空格，缩进的空格数不重要，只要相同层级的元素左对齐即可

docs.title: 注释
docs.text:
在 yaml 格式的文件中，以"#"作为注释开头，行尾为结尾，"#"必须在行头或者必须在前方有空格，否则不视为注释

port: 7890 # http 代理端口
socks-port: 7891
# socks 代理端口

docs.title: 对象
docs.text:
对象键值对使用冒号结构表示key: value,冒号后面要加一个空格，使用缩进表示层级关系

因yaml格式为json的超集，所以可以直接使用json的写法

docs.title: 多行
docs.text:
tun:
  enable: true
  stack: system
  auto-route: true
  auto-detect-interface: true

docs.title: 多行 json
docs.text:
tun: { 
  enable: true,
  stack: system,
  auto-route: true,
  auto-detect-interface: true
  }

docs.title: 单行 json
docs.text: tun: { enable: true, stack: system, auto-route: true, auto-detect-interface: true}

docs.title: 全 json
docs.text:
{
  "tun": {
    "enable": true,
    "stack": "system",
    "auto-route": true,
    "auto-detect-interface": true
  }
}

docs.title: 数组
docs.text: 以-开头的行表示构成一个数组，用于一个对象内的多个值

docs.title: 多行数组
docs.text:
a:
  - b
  - c
  - d

docs.title: 单行 json 数组
docs.text: a: [b, c, d]

docs.title: 引用
docs.text:
& 锚点和 * 别名，可以用来引用，& 用来建立锚点，<<表示合并到当前数据，* 用来引用锚点

如下示例中，因p这个键在mihomo中不存在，所以在mihomo解析配置会被忽视

如合并时有重复的项，则不会去合并

p: &p
  type: http
  interval: 3600
  health-check:
    enable: true
    url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
    interval: 300

proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    <<: *p
    url: ""
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider1.yaml

  provider2:
    <<: *p
    type: file
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider2.yaml

等同于

proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    type: http
    interval: 3600
    health-check:
      enable: true
      url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
      interval: 300
    url: ""
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider1.yaml

  provider2:
    interval: 3600
    health-check:
      enable: true
      url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
      interval: 300
    type: file
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider2.yaml

docs.title: 域名通配符
docs.text:
Note

本节中的域名通配符与路由规则中的DOMAIN-WILDCARD并不相同

docs.title: 通配符 *
docs.text:
Clash 的通配符 * 一次只能匹配一级域名

*.baidu.com 只匹配 tieba.baidu.com 而不匹配 123.tieba.baidu.com 或者 baidu.com

*只匹配 localhost 等没有.的主机名

docs.title: 通配符 +
docs.text:
通配符 ＋ 类似 DOMAIN-SUFFIX, 可以一次性匹配多个级别

＋.baidu.com 匹配 tieba.baidu.com 和 123.tieba.baidu.com 或者 baidu.com

通配符 ＋ 只能用于域名前缀匹配

docs.title: 通配符 .
docs.text:
通配符 . 可以一次性匹配多个级别

.baidu.com 匹配 tieba.baidu.com 和 123.tieba.baidu.com, 但不能匹配 baidu.com

通配符 . 只能用于域名前缀匹配

docs.title: 使用示例
docs.text:
使用通配符时，应当使用引号 ' '或 " "将内容包裹起来

fake-ip-filter:
- ".lan"
- "xbox.*.microsoft.com"
- "+.xboxlive.com"
- localhost.ptlogin2.qq.com

docs.title: 引入域名集合
docs.text:
Warning

rule-set 仅支持 behavior 为 domain/classical

fake-ip-filter:
- "rule-set:xxx"
- "geosite:xxx"

docs.title: 端口范围
docs.text: mihomo 可以使用 - 来匹配端口范围，使用 / 或者 , 来区分多个端口/端口范围

docs.title: Index
docs.text: 为了开始使用 mihomo, 你可以从以下安装方式中选择一个为当前系统安装 mihomo

docs.title: alpha 和 meta 分支的区别
docs.text: alpha 分支为最新提交分支，meta 分支每隔一段时间合并 alpha 分支的代码，meta 分支不一定比 alpha 分支更稳定。

docs.title: 我应该下载哪一个文件？
docs.text:
release 中，包的文件名中包含了多个信息，包括

  • 程序名称 (mihomo)
  • 操作系统（如 android、darwin、freebsd、linux、windows 等）
  • 架构（如 386、amd64、arm32v7、arm64 等）
  • 编译方式
    • v1/2/3：仅适用于AMD64平台，用于标记CPU指令集等级
    • 默认（无额外标识）: 使用 GOAMD64=v3 标签编译的默认版本
    • compatible: 使用 GOAMD64=v1 标签进行编译。该版本是为了兼容特定的操作系统或架构而编译的。
    • go120: 使用 Golang1.20 版本进行编译。该版本是为了兼容特定的操作系统或架构而编译的。
    • abi1/2: loongarch64的 abi 版本
  • 分支（alpha）
  • 提交的 git hash 值（如 f90066f）

可以根据这些信息选择你需要下载的可执行文件。

👉在此了解更多关于 GOAMD64 标签的信息

👉在此了解更多关于 Golang1.20 版本的系统兼容性信息

👉在此了解更多关于loongarch64abi 版本的信息

对于macos用户：根据go wiki，go1.25开始不再支持macos11，请macos11用户下载带有go124标签的二进制文件，macos10.15用户下载带有go122标签的二进制文件，macoc10.13用户下载带有go120标签的二进制文件

对于windows用户：目前官方构建的所有版本均支持win7及更高版本的系统（非官方构建不保证这一点，我们通过维护自己fork版本的golang来编译）

对于linux用户：根据go wiki，go1.24开始仅支持3.2+版本内核，请2.6.32~3.1版本内核用户下载带有go123标签的二进制文件

docs.title: 使用 systemd
docs.text:
• 下载二进制可执行文件 releases

  • 将下载的二进制可执行文件重名名为 mihomo 并移动到 /usr/local/bin/

  • 以守护进程的方式，运行 mihomo。

使用以下命令将 mihomo 二进制文件复制到 /usr/local/bin, 配置文件复制到 /etc/mihomo:

cp mihomo /usr/local/bin
cp config.yaml /etc/mihomo

创建 systemd 配置文件 /etc/systemd/system/mihomo.service:

[Unit]
Description=mihomo Daemon, Another Clash Kernel.
After=network.target NetworkManager.service systemd-networkd.service iwd.service

[Service]
Type=simple
LimitNPROC=500
LimitNOFILE=1000000
CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_NET_ADMIN CAP_NET_RAW CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE CAP_SYS_TIME CAP_SYS_PTRACE CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE
AmbientCapabilities=CAP_NET_ADMIN CAP_NET_RAW CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE CAP_SYS_TIME CAP_SYS_PTRACE CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE
Restart=always
ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/sleep 1s
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/mihomo -d /etc/mihomo
ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

使用以下命令重新加载 systemd:

systemctl daemon-reload

启用 mihomo 服务：

systemctl enable mihomo

使用以下命令立即启动 mihomo:

systemctl start mihomo

使用以下命令使 mihomo 重新加载：

systemctl reload mihomo

使用以下命令检查 mihomo 的运行状况：

systemctl status mihomo

使用以下命令检查 mihomo 的运行日志：

journalctl -u mihomo -o cat -e

或

journalctl -u mihomo -o cat -f

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The non-Chinese pages are translated by ChatGPT 3.5. Feel free to contribute in your local language.

This document is still under revision. Your pull requests are welcome.

docs.title: Request Example
docs.text:
Curl example: curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer ${secret}' http://${controller-api}/configs?force=true -d '{"path": "", "payload": ""}' -X PUT

This request includes the header 'Authorization: Bearer ${secret}', where:

  • ${secret} is the API key set in the configuration file api
  • ${controller-api} is the API listening address set in the configuration file api
  • ?force=true is a parameter that needs to be included in certain requests
  • '{"path": "", "payload": ""}' is the data for the resource to be updated

In most cases, the data passed is '{"path": "", "payload": ""}', which can include a new configuration file path.

Note

Note that if the path is not in the Clash working directory, please manually set the SAFE_PATHS environment variable to add it to the safe path. The syntax of this environment variable is the same as the PATH environment variable parsing rules of this operating system (i.e., semicolon-separated in Windows and colon-separated in other systems).

docs.title: /logs
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve real-time logs.

docs.title: /logs?level=log_level
docs.text:
Request Method: GET

  • Retrieve logs of a specified level. Possible values: info, debug, warning, error

docs.title: /traffic
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve real-time traffic, measured in kbps.

docs.title: /memory
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve real-time memory usage, measured in kb.

docs.title: /version
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve the Clash version.

docs.title: /cache/fakeip/flush
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Clear the fake IP cache.

docs.title: /configs
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve basic configuration.

Request method: PUT

  • Reload basic configuration; data must be sent, and the URL must include ?force=true to enforce execution.

Request method: PATCH

  • Update basic configuration; data must be sent in the format '{"mixed-port": 7890}', modified as needed for the configuration items to be updated.

docs.title: /configs/geo
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Update the GEO database; data must be sent.

docs.title: /restart
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Restart the kernel; data must be sent.

docs.title: /upgrade
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Update the kernel; data must be sent.

docs.title: /upgrade/ui
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Update the panel; external-ui must be set.

docs.title: /upgrade/geo
docs.text:
Request method: POST

  • Update the GEO database; data must be sent.

docs.title: /group
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve policy group information.

docs.title: /group/group_name
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve specific policy group information.

Request method: DELETE

  • Clear the fixed selection of the automatic policy group.

docs.title: /group/group_name/delay
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Test the nodes/strategy groups within the specified strategy group, return new latency information, and clear the fixed selection of the automatic strategy group
  • the URL must include ?url=xxx&timeout=5000, modified as needed.

docs.title: /proxies
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve proxy information.

docs.title: /proxies/proxies_name
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve specific proxy information.

Request method: PUT

  • Select a specific proxy; data must be included in the format '{"name":"Japan"}'.

docs.title: /proxies/proxies_name/delay
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Test a specified proxy and return new delay information
  • the URL must include ?url=xxx&timeout=5000, modified as needed.

docs.title: /providers/proxies
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve all information for all proxy sets.

docs.title: /providers/proxies/providers_name
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve information for a specific proxy set.

Request method: PUT

  • Update the proxy set.

docs.title: /providers/proxies/providers_name/healthcheck
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Trigger a health check for a specific proxy set.

docs.title: /providers/proxies/providers_name/proxies_name/healthcheck
docs.text:
• Test a specified proxy within the proxy set and return new delay information
  • the URL must include ?url=xxx&timeout=5000, modified as needed.

docs.title: /rules
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve rule information.

docs.title: /providers/rules
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve all information for all rule sets.

docs.title: /providers/rules/providers_name
docs.text:
Request method: PUT

  • Update the rule set.

docs.title: /connections
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve connection information.

Request method: DELETE

  • Close all connections.

docs.title: /connections/:id
docs.text:
Request method: DELETE

  • Close a specific connection.

docs.title: /dns/query
docs.text:
Request method: GET

  • Retrieve DNS query data for a specified name and type
  • the URL must include ?name=example.com&type=A, modified as needed.

docs.title: DEBUG
docs.text: /debug requires the kernel to be started with the log level set to debug.

docs.title: /debug/gc
docs.text:
Request method: PUT

  • Perform active garbage collection.

docs.title: /debug/pprof
docs.text:
Open in a browser http://${controller-api}/debug/pprof to view raw DEBUG information, where:

  • allocs indicates memory allocation for each function call, including the size of memory allocated on the stack and heap, as well as the number of allocations. This report is primarily to help identify memory leaks and frequent memory requests in the code.
  • The heap report provides detailed information about memory usage on the heap, including the size, number, and address of allocated memory blocks, sorted by size. This report is mainly to locate areas of excessive memory usage; we can check object sizes in the heap report to find areas of high memory consumption.

docs.title: Install Graphviz to view graphical debug information.
View Graphical Heap Report
docs.text:
go tool pprof -http=:8080 http://127.0.0.1:xxxx/debug/pprof/heap

Full image

docs.title: View Graphical Allocs Report
docs.text:
go tool pprof -http=:8080 http://127.0.0.1:xxxx/debug/pprof/allocs

Sample output

docs.title: Submit Output Report
docs.text: Access http://${controller-api}/debug/pprof/heap?raw=true in a browser to download this file, and upload it to issues to report any problems you encounter.

docs.title: Index
docs.text:
• Inbounds

    test

  • Routing Rules

    test

  • Outbound Proxies

    test

  • Proxy Groups

    test

  • DNS

    test

docs.title: Experimental configuration
docs.text:
experimental:
  quic-go-disable-gso: false
  quic-go-disable-ecn: false

docs.title: quic-go-disable-gso
docs.text: Disable GSO (Generic Segmentation Offload).

docs.title: quic-go-disable-ecn
docs.text: Disable ECN (Explicit Congestion Notification).

docs.title: dialer-ip4p-convert
docs.text: Enable IP4P address conversion.

docs.title: Allow LAN
docs.text:
Allows other devices to access the internet through Clash proxy port.

Optional values: true/false

allow-lan: true

Binding address, only allows other devices to access through this address.

  • "*" binds to all IP addresses.
  • "192.168.31.31" binds to a single IPV4 address.
  • "[aaaa::a8aa:ff:fe09:57d8]" binds to a single IPV6 address.
bind-address: "*"

Allowed IP address ranges for connection, applicable only when allow-lan is set to true. Default values are 0.0.0.0/0 and ::/0.

lan-allowed-ips:
- 0.0.0.0/0
- ::/0

Disallowed IP address ranges for connection. Blacklist takes precedence over whitelist, default is empty.

lan-disallowed-ips:
- 192.168.0.3/32

docs.title: User Authentication
docs.text:
User authentication for http(s), socks, and mixed proxies.

authentication:
- "user1:pass1"
- "user2:pass2"

Set the IP ranges allowed to skip authentication.

skip-auth-prefixes:
- 127.0.0.1/8
- ::1/128

docs.title: Operation Mode
docs.text:
• rule Rule-based matching
  • global Global proxy (requires selecting proxy/strategy in GLOBAL proxy group)
  • direct Global direct connection

defaulting to rule mode.

mode: rule

docs.title: Log Level
docs.text:
Controls the logging level of Clash core, only output to console and control page.

log-level: info
  • silent Silent, no output.
  • error Outputs logs of errors and unusable logs.
  • warning Outputs logs of errors that do not affect operations, and logs of error level.
  • info Outputs general operational logs, as well as logs of error and warning levels.
  • debug Outputs as much information as possible during runtime.

docs.title: IPv6
docs.text:
Whether to allow the kernel to accept IPv6 traffic.

default is true.

ipv6: true

docs.title: TCP Keep Alive Settings
docs.text:
Modify this item to reduce the power consumption issue on mobile devices

The interval for TCP Keep Alive packets, measured in seconds.

keep-alive-interval: 15

The maximum idle time for TCP Keep Alive.

keep-alive-idle: 15

Disable TCP Keep Alive; on Android, this is forcibly enabled by default.

disable-keep-alive: false

docs.title: Process Matching Mode
docs.text:
Controls whether Clash matches processes.

  • always Enables, forces matching of all processes.
  • strict Default, Clash determines whether to enable.
  • off Does not match processes, recommended for use on routers.
find-process-mode: strict

docs.title: External Control (API)
docs.text:
External controller, allows controlling your Clash kernel using RESTful API.

API listening address, you can change 127.0.0.1 to 0.0.0.0 to listen on all IPs.

external-controller: 127.0.0.1:9090

API CORS Header Configuration

external-controller-cors:
  allow-origins:
    - '*'
  allow-private-network: true

Unix socket API listening address

Accessing API endpoints via Unix socket does not verify secrets. If enabled, please ensure security measures are in place.

external-controller-unix: mihomo.sock

Windows Named Pipe API Listening Address

Accessing the API interface via Windows Named Pipe does not validate the secret. If enabled, please ensure your security.

external-controller-pipe: \\.\pipe\mihomo

HTTPS-API listening address, requires configuring the tls section for certificate and private key configuration, external-controller must also be filled in.

external-controller-tls: 127.0.0.1:9443

Access key for the API.

secret: ""

docs.title: External User Interface
docs.text:
Allows running static webpage resources (such as Clash-dashboard) on Clash API, path is API address/ui.

external-ui: /path/to/ui/folder

Can be an absolute path or a relative path to the Clash working directory.

Note

Note that if the path is not in the Clash working directory, please manually set the SAFE_PATHS environment variable to add it to the safe path. The syntax of this environment variable is the same as the PATH environment variable parsing rules of this operating system (i.e., semicolon-separated in Windows and colon-separated in other systems).

docs.title: Custom External User Interface Name
docs.text:
external-ui-name: xd      # Merged into external-ui/xd

Not mandatory, will be updated to the specified folder during updates, if not configured, it will be updated directly to the external-ui directory.

docs.title: Custom External User Interface Download URL
docs.text: external-ui-url: "<https://github.com/MetaCubeX/metacubexd/archive/refs/heads/gh-pages.zip>" # Get from GitHub Pages branch

docs.title: Cache
docs.text:
profile:
  store-selected: true

# Stores API selections for strategy groups for use on the next start

  store-fake-ip: true

# Stores the fakeip mapping table, using the original mapping address when the domain connects again

docs.title: Unified Delay
docs.text:
When unified delay is enabled, two delay tests are conducted to eliminate latency differences caused by connection handshakes and other variations in different types of nodes.

unified-delay: true

docs.title: TCP Concurrency
docs.text:
Enable TCP concurrent connections, which will use all IP addresses resolved by DNS for connections, using the first successful connection.

tcp-concurrent: true

docs.title: Outbound Interface
docs.text:
mihomo's traffic outbound interface.

interface-name: en0

docs.title: Routing Mark
docs.text:
Provides a default traffic mark for outbound connections on Linux.

routing-mark: 6666

docs.title: TLS
docs.text:
Currently only used for https in API.

tls:
  certificate: string # Certificate PEM format or certificate path
  private-key: string # Private key PEM format corresponding to the certificate, or private key path
  ech-key: |-
    -----BEGIN ECH KEYS-----
    ACATwY30o/RKgD6hgeQxwrSiApLaCgU+HKh7B6SUrAHaDwBD/g0APwAAIAAgHjzK
    madSJjYQIf9o1N5GXjkW4DEEeb17qMxHdwMdNnwADAABAAEAAQACAAEAAwAIdGVz
    dC5jb20AAA==
    -----END ECH KEYS-----
  # ECH keys, if not empty, ECH will be enabled.

docs.title: Global Client Fingerprint
docs.text:
Global TLS fingerprint, lower priority than client-fingerprint inside proxy.

Currently supports TCP/grpc/WS/HTTP transport with TLS, supported protocols are VLESS, Vmess, and trojan.

global-client-fingerprint: chrome

Note

Options: chrome, firefox, safari, iOS, android, edge, 360, qq, random If random is selected, a modern browser fingerprint will be generated based on Cloudflare Radar data.

docs.title: GEO Data Mode
docs.text:
Change the geoip usage file, mmdb or dat,true is dat, with a default value of false.

geodata-mode: true

docs.title: GEO File Loading Mode
docs.text:
Optional loading modes are as follows:

  • standard: Standard loader
  • memconservative: Loader optimized for memory-limited (small memory) devices (default)
geodata-loader: memconservative

docs.title: Auto Update GEO
docs.text:
geo-auto-update: false

Update interval, unit is hours

geo-update-interval: 24

docs.title: Custom GEO Download Address
docs.text:
geox-url:
  geoip: "https://testingcf.jsdelivr.net/gh/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat@release/geoip.dat"
  geosite: "https://testingcf.jsdelivr.net/gh/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat@release/geosite.dat"
  mmdb: "https://testingcf.jsdelivr.net/gh/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat@release/country.mmdb"
  asn: "https://github.com/xishang0128/geoip/releases/download/latest/GeoLite2-ASN.mmdb"

docs.title: Custom Global UA
docs.text:
Custom UA used when downloading external resources, default is clash.meta.

global-ua: clash.meta

docs.title: ETag Support
docs.text:
ETag support for external resource downloads is enabled by default.

etag-support: true

docs.title: TUNNEL
docs.text:
Flow forwarding tunnel, capable of forwarding TCP/UDP traffic, and can also be forwarded through a proxy.

tunnels:
- tcp/udp,127.0.0.1:6553,114.114.114.114:53,proxy
- network: [tcp, udp]
  address: 127.0.0.1:7777
  target: target.com
  proxy: proxy

docs.title: Single Line
docs.text:
tunnels:
- tcp/udp,127.0.0.1:6553,8.8.8.8:53,proxy

docs.title: Multiple Lines
docs.text:
tunnels:
- network: [tcp, udp]
  address: 127.0.0.1:6553
  target: 8.8.8.8:53
  proxy: proxy

In the single line example, the order corresponds to the multiple lines: network/address/target/proxy.

docs.title: network
docs.text: The type of network to listen to, can be tcp/udp.

docs.title: address
docs.text: Local listening address.

docs.title: target
docs.text: The forwarding target address.

docs.title: proxy
docs.text:
Optional, traffic sent through a specific proxies/proxy-groups.

In the above example, accessing 127.0.0.1:6553 is forwarded through the proxy in the proxies/proxy-groups to access 8.8.8.8:53.

docs.title: DNS
docs.text:
dns:
  enable: true
  cache-algorithm: arc
  prefer-h3: false
  use-hosts: true
  use-system-hosts: true
  respect-rules: false
  listen: 0.0.0.0:1053
  ipv6: false
  default-nameserver:
    - 223.5.5.5
  enhanced-mode: fake-ip
  fake-ip-range: 198.18.0.1/16
  fake-ip-filter-mode: blacklist
  fake-ip-filter:
    - '*.lan'
  nameserver-policy:
    '+.arpa': '10.0.0.1'
    'rule-set:cn':
    - https://doh.pub/dns-query
    - https://dns.alidns.com/dns-query
  nameserver:
    - https://doh.pub/dns-query
    - https://dns.alidns.com/dns-query
  fallback:
    - tls://8.8.4.4
    - tls://1.1.1.1
  proxy-server-nameserver:
    - https://doh.pub/dns-query
  fallback-filter:
    geoip: true
    geoip-code: CN
    geosite:
      - gfw
    ipcidr:
      - 240.0.0.0/4
    domain:
      - '+.google.com'
      - '+.facebook.com'
      - '+.youtube.com'

docs.title: enable
docs.text: Whether to enable; if set to false, the system DNS resolution will be used.

docs.title: cache-algorithm
docs.text:
supports the following algorithms:

  • lru: Least Recently Used, default value
  • arc: Adaptive Replacement Cache

docs.title: prefer-h3
docs.text: DOH will prioritize the use of HTTP/3.

docs.title: listen
docs.text: DNS service listening, supports UDP, TCP.

docs.title: IPV6
docs.text: Whether to resolve IPV6; if set to false, it will respond with empty resolutions for AAAA records.

docs.title: enhanced-mode
docs.text:
Optional values are fake-ip/redir-host, default is redir-host.

This refers to the DNS processing mode of mihomo.

docs.title: fake-ip-range
docs.text: Settings for the IP range under fakeip; the default IPV4 address for tun also uses this value as a reference.

docs.title: fake-ip-filter
docs.text:
Fakeip filtering; the following addresses will not receive fakeip mappings for connections.

Values support domain wildcards and importing domain sets.

docs.title: fake-ip-filter-mode: blacklist
docs.text: Optional values are blacklist/whitelist, default is blacklist. In whitelist, only successful matches will return fake-ip.

docs.title: use-hosts
docs.text: Whether to respond to the configured hosts; default is true.

docs.title: use-system-hosts
docs.text: Whether to query the system hosts; default is true.

docs.title: respect-rules
docs.text:
DNS connections comply with routing rules, requiring configuration of proxy-server-nameserver.

It is strongly not recommended to use it with prefer-h3.

docs.title: default-nameserver
docs.text:
Default DNS, used for resolving the domain names of DNS servers.

Must be an IP, can be encrypted DNS.

docs.title: nameserver-policy
docs.text:
Specifies the resolving servers for domain queries, can use geosite, prioritized over nameserver/fallback queries.

Keys support domain wildcards.

Values support strings/arrays.

docs.title: proxy-server-nameserver
docs.text: The proxy node domain resolution server is used solely for resolving the domain names of proxy nodes. If left blank, it will follow the configurations of nameserver-policy, nameserver, and fallback.

docs.title: direct-nameserver
docs.text: The DNS server for domain resolution at the direct exit. If left blank, it will follow the configurations of nameserver-policy, nameserver, and fallback.

docs.title: direct-nameserver-follow-policy
docs.text: Indicates whether to adhere to the nameserver-policy. The default is not to comply, and it only takes effect when direct-nameserver is not empty.

docs.title: nameserver
docs.text: Default domain name resolution server.

docs.title: fallback
docs.text:
Backup domain name resolution servers, generally using overseas DNS to ensure reliable results.

After configuring fallback, fallback-filter is enabled by default, with geoip-code set to CN.

docs.title: fallback-filter
docs.text: Filtering for backup domain name resolution servers; those meeting the conditions will use fallback results or only use fallback for resolution.

docs.title: geoip
docs.text: Whether to enable geoip judgment.

docs.title: geoip-code
docs.text:
Optional values are country abbreviations, default value is CN.

Results from IPs other than those configured with geoip-code will be considered polluted.

Results from the country configured with geoip-code will be adopted directly; otherwise, fallback results will be used.

docs.title: geosite
docs.text:
Optional values are collections included in the corresponding geosite.

Contents of the geosite list are considered polluted; domain names matching the geosite will only use fallback resolution, not nameserver.

docs.title: ipcidr
docs.text:
Written as IP/mask.

Results from these subnets will be considered polluted; when nameserver resolves these results, it will adopt fallback resolution results.

docs.title: domain
docs.text: These domains are considered polluted; matching these domains will directly use fallback resolution, not nameserver.

docs.title: Additional Parameters
docs.text:
This section can be used for DNS servers directed to public network addresses, using # for addition and & to connect different parameters.

Except for specifying the proxy/interface and ecs, the values of the remaining items are all bool (true/false).

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
dns:
  nameserver:
  - 'https://8.8.8.8/dns-query#proxy&ecs=1.1.1.1/24&ecs-override=true'
proxies:
- name: proxy
  type: ss

docs.title: DNS specifies proxy/interface for connection
docs.text:
Prefer using existing proxies; if a proxy with that name does not exist, specify the interface for connection.

#RULES is to connect in accordance with routing rules, equivalent to respect-rules.

If querying through a proxy is required, proxy-server-nameserver should be configured to prevent egg issues.

docs.title: h3
docs.text:
Force HTTP/3

This option does not conflict with prefer-h3. After filling it in, it forces the use of HTTP/3 to establish a DOH connection. Please ensure that the DOH server supports HTTP/3 before using it.

docs.title: skip-cert-verify
docs.text: Skip TLS certificate verification

docs.title: ecs
docs.text: Specify the subnet address for DNS queries

docs.title: ecs-override
docs.text: Forcefully override the subnet address of DNS queries

docs.title: disable-ipv4
docs.text: Discard A responses

docs.title: disable-ipv6
docs.text: Discard AAAA response

docs.title: hosts
docs.text:
hosts:
  '*.clash.dev': 127.0.0.1
  'alpha.clash.dev': '::1'
  test.com: [1.1.1.1, 2.2.2.2]
  baidu.com: google.com

Keys support domain wildcards.

Values support strings/arrays; domain redirection does not support arrays.

Note

A complete domain takes precedence over domains using wildcards, for example: foo.example.com > *.example.com > .example.com.

docs.title: Proxy Ports
docs.text: HTTP/SOCKS/Mixed Port Verification and External Access

docs.title: HTTP(S) Proxy Port
docs.text: port: 7890

docs.title: SOCKS4/4a/5 Proxy Port
docs.text: socks-port: 7891

docs.title: Mixed Port
docs.text:
Note

The mixed port is a special port that supports both HTTP(S) and SOCKS5 protocols. You can connect to this port using any program that supports HTTP or SOCKS proxies.

mixed-port: 7892

docs.title: Transparent Proxy Port
docs.text:
Note

The redirect port is applicable only for Linux (Android) and macOS, while the tproxy port is applicable only for Linux (Android).

The redirect transparent proxy port can only proxy TCP traffic.

redir-port: 7893

The tproxy transparent proxy port can proxy both TCP and UDP traffic.

tproxy-port: 7894

docs.title: HTTP
docs.text:
listeners:
- name: http-in
  type: http
  port: 7890
  listen: 0.0.0.0
  users:
    - username: username1
      password: password1
  certificate: ./server.crt
  private-key: ./server.key

docs.title: User Authentication
docs.text: If the users field is not filled in, it will follow the global User Authentication settings. If it is filled in, the global settings will be ignored. To skip authentication for this inbound connection, you can set users: [].

docs.title: MIXED
docs.text:
listeners:
- name: mixed-in
  type: mixed
  port: 7892
  listen: 0.0.0.0
  udp: true
  users:
    - username: username1
      password: password1
  certificate: ./server.crt
  private-key: ./server.key

docs.title: UDP
docs.text: Whether to listen for UDP

docs.title: User Authentication
docs.text: If the users field is left empty, it will follow the global User Authentication settings. If filled in, it will override the global settings. To skip authentication for this inbound connection, you can specify users: []

docs.title: SOCKS
docs.text:
listeners:
- name: socks-in
  type: socks
  port: 7891
  listen: 0.0.0.0
  udp: true
  users:
    - username: username1
      password: password1
  certificate: ./server.crt
  private-key: ./server.key

docs.title: UDP
docs.text: Whether to listen for UDP

docs.title: User Authentication
docs.text: If the users field is not filled in, it will follow the global User Authentication settings. If it is filled in, the global settings will be ignored. To bypass authentication for this inbound connection, you can set users: []

docs.title: DIRECT
docs.text: Direct, data exits directly.

docs.title: REJECT
docs.text: Reject, intercepts data from going out.

docs.title: REJECT-DROP
docs.text: Reject, unlike REJECT, this strategy silently drops the request.

docs.title: PASS
docs.text: Bypass, skipping this rule when matching.

docs.title: COMPATIBLE
docs.text: Compatible, appears when no node is selected in the policy group filtering, equivalent to DIRECT.

docs.title: Hysteria2
docs.text:
Configuration Reference

proxies:
- name: "hysteria2"
  type: hysteria2
  server: server.com
  port: 443
  ports: 443-8443
  password: yourpassword
  up: "30 Mbps"
  down: "200 Mbps"
  obfs: salamander # Default is empty; if filled, obfs is enabled. Currently, only salamander is supported.
  obfs-password: yourpassword

  sni: server.com
  skip-cert-verify: false
  fingerprint: xxxx
  alpn:
    - h3

Common Fields

TLS Fields

docs.title: Ports
docs.text: Configuring this enables port jumping, ignoring port. Refer to Port Range for format.

docs.title: Password
docs.text: Authentication password.

docs.title: Up/Down
docs.text: Brutal rate control; if no unit is specified, the default is Mbps.

docs.title: Obfs
docs.text: QUIC traffic obfuscator type, can only be set to salamander. If left empty, it is disabled.

docs.title: Obfs-password
docs.text: QUIC traffic obfuscator password.

docs.title: TLS Configuration
docs.text:
proxies:
- name: "tls-example"
  tls: true
  sni: example.com
  servername: example.com
  fingerprint: xxx
  alpn:
  - h2
  - http/1.1
  skip-cert-verify: true
  # certificate: xxxx
  # private-key: xxx
  client-fingerprint: random
  reality-opts:
    public-key: xxxx
    short-id: xxxx
    support-x25519mlkem768: true
  ech-opts:
    enable: true
    config: base64_encoded_config

docs.title: tls
docs.text: Enables TLS, applicable only to protocols that use tls, with the trojan protocol requiring it to be enabled.

docs.title: sni/servername
docs.text: The server name indication, referred to as servername in VMess/VLESS. If left empty, it defaults to the address in server.

docs.title: fingerprint
docs.text: Certificate fingerprint, applicable only to protocols that use tls.

docs.title: alpn
docs.text:
List of supported Application Layer Protocol Negotiation options, arranged in order of priority.

If both peers support ALPN, the selected protocol will be one from this list; if there are no mutually supported protocols, the connection will fail.

Refer to Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation

docs.title: skip-cert-verify
docs.text: Bypasses certificate verification, applicable only to protocols that use tls.

docs.title: certificate
docs.text: If filled, this enables mTLS (must be filled in with private-key). The content is the certificate in PEM format or the path to the certificate.

docs.title: private-key
docs.text: If filled, this enables mTLS (must be filled in with certificate). The content is the private key corresponding to the certificate in PEM format or the path to the private key.

docs.title: client-fingerprint
docs.text: Client uTLS fingerprint, applicable only to VMess/VLESS/Trojan protocols. For optional details, refer to Global Client Fingerprint.

docs.title: reality-opts
docs.text: Configuration for reality; if not empty, reality will be enabled.

docs.title: reality-opts.public-key
docs.text: Public key corresponding to the reality server's private key.

docs.title: reality-opts.short-id
docs.text: One of the server's short IDs.

docs.title: reality-opts.support-x25519mlkem768
docs.text: Support for X25519-MLKEM768 key exchange.

docs.title: ech-opts.enable
docs.text: Enables ECH (Encrypted Client Hello). If not empty, ECH will be enabled.

docs.title: ech-opts.config
docs.text: Base64-encoded configuration for ECH.

docs.title: General Fields
docs.text:
proxy-groups:
- name: "proxy"
  type: select
  proxies:
  - DIRECT
  - ss
  use:
  - provider1
  - provider1

  url: 'https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204'
  interval: 300
  lazy: true
  timeout: 5000
  max-failed-times: 5

  disable-udp: true
  interface-name: en0
  routing-mark: 11451
  include-all: false
  include-all-proxies: false
  include-all-providers: false
  filter: "(?i)港|hk|hongkong|hong kong"
  exclude-filter: "美|日"
  exclude-type: "Shadowsocks|Http"
  expected-status: 204
  hidden: true
  icon: xxx

docs.title: name
docs.text:
Required, the name of the proxy group.

Note

If there are special characters, they should be enclosed in quotes.

docs.title: type
docs.text: Required, the type of the proxy group.

docs.title: proxies
docs.text: References to outbound proxies or other proxy groups.

docs.title: use
docs.text: References to proxy sets.

docs.title: url
docs.text:
Health check test address.

Note

It will only check the proxies field of the proxy group, and will not check the proxies of the proxy providers introduced through use.

docs.title: interval
docs.text: Health check interval; if not 0, periodic testing is enabled, measured in seconds.

docs.title: lazy
docs.text: Lazy state, defaults to true. If the current proxy group is not selected, no testing is performed.

docs.title: timeout
docs.text: Health check timeout, measured in milliseconds.

docs.title: max-failed-times
docs.text: Maximum number of failures; exceeding this triggers a forced health check, default is 5.

docs.title: disable-udp
docs.text: Disables UDP for this proxy group.

docs.title: interface-name
docs.text:
Warning

The interface-name in the proxy group is deprecated, please use the interface-name in the proxy node.

Specifies the outbound interface for the proxy group.

Priority: Proxy Node > Proxy Policy > Global.

docs.title: routing-mark
docs.text:
Warning

The routing-mark in the proxy group is deprecated, please use the routing-mark in the proxy node.

The routing mark attached when the proxy group is outbound.

Priority: Proxy Node > Proxy Policy > Global.

docs.title: include-all
docs.text:
Includes all outbound proxies and proxy sets, sorted by name.

Inclusion does not include proxy groups; other proxy groups can be included in proxies.

docs.title: include-all-proxies
docs.text:
Includes all outbound proxies, sorted by name.

Inclusion does not include proxy groups; other proxy groups can be included in proxies.

docs.title: include-all-providers
docs.text:
Includes all proxy sets, sorted by name.

This will invalidate including proxy sets.

docs.title: filter
docs.text:
Filters nodes that meet keywords or regular expressions. You can use ` to separate multiple regular expressions.

This only applies to included proxy sets and including all outbound proxies.

docs.title: exclude-filter
docs.text: Excludes nodes that meet keywords or regular expressions. You can use ` to separate multiple regular expressions.

docs.title: exclude-type
docs.text:
Regular expressions are not supported. Split by |, exclude based on node type, only excluding ingress outbound proxies

For supported types, please refer to Adapter Type, ignore case sensitivity

docs.title: expected-status
docs.text: The expected HTTP response status code during health checks. If this field is configured, a node is considered available only when the response status code matches the expected status. The default is *, indicating no requirements on the response status.

docs.title: syntax
docs.text: You can use / to match multiple status codes, - to match a range of statuses, and mix them.

docs.title: example
docs.text:
Match status codes 200 and 302.

expected-status: 200/302

Match status codes from 400 to 503.

expected-status: 400-503

Match status codes 200 and 302, as well as from 400 to 503.

expected-status: 200/302/400-503

docs.title: hidden
docs.text: Returns hidden status in the API to hide the display of this proxy group (requires front-end adaptation using the API).

docs.title: icon
docs.text: Returns the string input for icon in the API to display in this proxy group (requires front-end adaptation using the API).

docs.title: GLOBAL
docs.text:
Default fill all proxy-groups and proxies

The strategy group can also be customized in the configuration file

However, the web panel and some client applications sort according to the order of policy groups within the GLOBAL policy group

It is recommended to write out all the policy groups of the current configuration in full (except for the GLOBAL itself) when customizing the GLOBAL policy group

docs.title: Fallback
docs.text:
proxy-groups:
- name: "fallback"
  type: fallback
  proxies:
  - ss
  - vmess
  url: 'https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204'
  interval: 300
  #lazy: true

If the current node times out, the first available node will be selected in the order of proxies

docs.title: Common Fields
docs.text: Refer to Common Fields.

docs.title: Load-balance
docs.text:
proxy-groups:
- name: "load-balance"
  type: load-balance
  proxies:
  - ss1
  - ss2
  - vmess1
  url: 'https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204'
  interval: 300
  #lazy: true
  #strategy: consistent-hashing # or round-robin

docs.title: Common Fields
docs.text: Refer to Common Fields.

docs.title: Strategy
docs.text:
Load Balancing Strategies

  • round-robin will distribute all requests among different proxy nodes within the strategy group.

  • consistent-hashing will assign requests with the same target address to the same proxy node within the strategy group.

  • sticky-sessions: requests with the same source address and target address will be directed to the same proxy node within the strategy group, with a cache expiration of 10 minutes.

Note

When the target address is a domain, it uses top-level domain matching.

docs.title: Relay
docs.text:
Proxy Groups:
# Traffic: Clash <-> http <-> vmess <-> ss1 <-> ss2 <-> Internet
- name: "relay"
  type: relay
  proxies:
    - http
    - vmess
    - ss1
    - ss2

Warning

The relay strategy is about to be deprecated. Please use dialer-proxy.

WireGuard currently does not support usage in relay, so please also use dialer-proxy.

The traffic flow is Clash <-> http <-> vmess <-> ss1 <-> ss2 <-> Internet.

docs.title: About UDP
docs.text: Relay supports the transmission of UDP, provided that both the head and tail nodes of the proxy chain support UDP over TCP. Currently, the protocols that support UDP include vmess, vless, trojan, ss, ssr, and tuic.

docs.title: Common Fields
docs.text: Refer to Common Fields.

docs.title: Common Fields
docs.text: Refer to Common Fields.

docs.title: tolerance
docs.text: proxies switch tolerance, measured in milliseconds (ms).

docs.title: Proxy Providers
docs.text:
proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    type: http
    url: "http://test.com"
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider1.yaml
    interval: 3600
    proxy: DIRECT
    size-limit: 0
    header:
      User-Agent:
      - "Clash/v1.18.0"
      - "mihomo/1.18.3"
      Authorization:
      - 'token 1231231'
    health-check:
      enable: true
      url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
      interval: 300
      timeout: 5000
      lazy: true
      expected-status: 204
    override:
      tfo: false
      mptcp: false
      udp: true
      udp-over-tcp: false
      down: "50 Mbps"
      up: "10 Mbps"
      skip-cert-verify: true
      dialer-proxy: proxy
      interface-name: tailscale0
      routing-mark: 233
      ip-version: ipv4-prefer
      additional-prefix: "provider1 prefix |"
      additional-suffix: "| provider1 suffix"
      proxy-name:
      - pattern: "IPLC-(.*?)倍"
        target: "iplc x $1"
    filter: "(?i)港|hk|hongkong|hong kong"
    exclude-filter: "xxx"
    exclude-type: "ss|http"
    payload:
      - name: "ss1"
        type: ss
        server: server
        port: 443
        cipher: chacha20-ietf-poly1305
        password: "password"

docs.title: Name
docs.text: Required, such as provider1, must be unique. It is advisable not to duplicate names with policy groups.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Required, provider type, options are http / file / inline.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: If the type is http, this must be configured.

docs.title: Path
docs.text:
Optional, the file path, must be unique. If not provided, the MD5 of the URL will be used as the filename.

For security reasons, this path is restricted to only allow locations within HomeDir (configured with the -d startup parameter). If you want to store it in other locations, please specify additional safe paths by setting the SAFE_PATHS environment variable. The syntax of this environment variable is the same as the PATH environment variable parsing rules of this operating system (that is, it is separated by semicolons in Windows and by colons in other systems).

docs.title: Interval
docs.text: The update time for the provider, measured in seconds.

docs.title: Proxy
docs.text: Download/update through the specified proxy.

docs.title: size-limit
docs.text: The maximum size of downloadable files is restricted, with the default being 0, which means no size limit; the unit is bytes (b)

docs.title: Header
docs.text: Custom HTTP request headers.

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text: Health check (latency testing).

docs.title: health-check.enable
docs.text: Whether to enable, optional true/false.

docs.title: health-check.url
docs.text:
Health check address, it is recommended to use one of the following addresses:

CloudflareGoogle 
https://cp.cloudflare.com

https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204

docs.title: health-check.interval
docs.text: Health check interval, measured in seconds.

docs.title: health-check.timeout
docs.text: Health check timeout, measured in milliseconds.

docs.title: health-check.lazy
docs.text: Lazy state, defaults to true, no testing is performed when this provider node is not in use.

docs.title: health-check.expected-status
docs.text: Refer to expected status.

docs.title: Override
docs.text: Override node content, the following fields are supported.

docs.title: override.additional-prefix
docs.text: Add a fixed prefix to the node name.

docs.title: override.additional-suffix
docs.text: Add a fixed suffix to the node name.

docs.title: override.proxy-name
docs.text: Replace the content of the node name, supporting regular expressions, where pattern is the replacement content and target is the replacement target.

docs.title: override.Configuration_items
docs.text:
Refer to common fields tfo

Refer to common fields mptcp

Refer to common fields udp.

Refer to Shadowsocks udp-over-tcp

Refer to Hysteria/Hysteria2 up.

Refer to Hysteria/Hysteria2 down.

Refer to common fields skip-cert-verify.

Refer to common fields dialer-proxy.

Refer to common fields interface-name.

Refer to common fields routing-mark.

Refer to common fields ip-version.

docs.title: Filter
docs.text: Filter nodes that meet keywords or regular expressions, multiple regular expressions can be separated by `.

docs.title: Exclude Filter
docs.text: Exclude nodes that meet keywords or regular expressions, multiple regular expressions can be separated by `.

docs.title: Exclude Type
docs.text:
Regular expressions are not supported; use | to separate and exclude based on node type.

The exclude-type of the provider uses the type from the configuration file for exclusion

docs.title: payload
docs.text:
Content, only effective when type is inline

When the http or file parsing fails, the payload can also be used as a backup proxy.

docs.title: rule-provider
docs.text:
rule-providers:
  google:
    type: http
    path: ./rule1.yaml
    url: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/../Google.yaml"
    interval: 600
    proxy: DIRECT
    behavior: classical
    format: yaml
    size-limit: 0

docs.title: name
docs.text: Required, such as google, must be unique.

docs.title: type
docs.text: Required, provider type, options are http / file / inline.

docs.title: url
docs.text: Must be configured if the type is http.

docs.title: path
docs.text:
Optional, file path, must be unique. If not provided, the MD5 of the URL will be used as the filename.

For security reasons, this path is restricted to only allow locations within HomeDir (configured with the -d startup parameter). If you want to store it in other locations, please specify additional safe paths by setting the SAFE_PATHS environment variable. The syntax of this environment variable is the same as the PATH environment variable parsing rules of this operating system (that is, it is separated by semicolons in Windows and by colons in other systems).

docs.title: interval
docs.text: The update interval for the provider, in seconds.

docs.title: proxy
docs.text: Download/update through the specified proxy.

docs.title: behavior
docs.text: Behavior, options are domain / ipcidr / classical, corresponding to different formats of rule-provider files. Please fill in according to the actual format.

docs.title: format
docs.text:
Format, options are yaml / text / mrs, default is yaml.

Currently, mrs behavior only supports domain / ipcidr. You can convert using mihomo convert-ruleset domain/ipcidr yaml/text XXX.yaml XXX.mrs.

docs.title: size-limit
docs.text: The maximum size of downloadable files is restricted, with the default being 0, which means no size limit; the unit is bytes (b)

docs.title: payload
docs.text: Content, only effective when type is inline

docs.title: classical
docs.text:
The classical type supports all types of routing rules (except for rule-set/sub-rule).

yamltext 
payload:
- DOMAIN-SUFFIX,google.com
- DOMAIN-KEYWORD,google
- DOMAIN,ad.com
- SRC-IP-CIDR,192.168.1.201/32
- IP-CIDR,127.0.0.0/8
- GEOIP,CN
- DST-PORT,80
- SRC-PORT,7777

DOMAIN-SUFFIX,google.com
DOMAIN-KEYWORD,google
DOMAIN,ad.com
SRC-IP-CIDR,192.168.1.201/32
IP-CIDR,127.0.0.0/8
GEOIP,CN
DST-PORT,80
SRC-PORT,7777

docs.title: domain
docs.text:
The content of the domain rule set must adhere to the clash wildcard.

yamltext 
payload:
- '.blogger.com'
- '*.*.microsoft.com'
- 'books.itunes.apple.com'

.blogger.com
*.*.microsoft.com
books.itunes.apple.com

docs.title: Routing Rules
docs.text:
rules:
- DOMAIN,ad.com,REJECT
- DOMAIN-SUFFIX,google.com,auto
- DOMAIN-KEYWORD,google,auto
- DOMAIN-WILDCARD,*.google.com,auto
- DOMAIN-REGEX,^abc.*com,PROXY
- GEOSITE,youtube,PROXY

- IP-CIDR,127.0.0.0/8,DIRECT,no-resolve
- IP-CIDR6,2620:0:2d0:200::7/32,auto
- IP-SUFFIX,8.8.8.8/24,PROXY
- IP-ASN,13335,DIRECT
- GEOIP,CN,DIRECT

- SRC-GEOIP,cn,DIRECT
- SRC-IP-ASN,9808,DIRECT
- SRC-IP-CIDR,192.168.1.201/32,DIRECT
- SRC-IP-SUFFIX,192.168.1.201/8,DIRECT

- DST-PORT,80,DIRECT
- SRC-PORT,7777,DIRECT

- IN-PORT,7890,PROXY
- IN-TYPE,SOCKS/HTTP,PROXY
- IN-USER,mihomo,PROXY
- IN-NAME,ss,PROXY

- PROCESS-PATH,/usr/bin/wget,PROXY
- PROCESS-PATH,C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe,PROXY
- PROCESS-PATH-REGEX,.*bin/wget,PROXY
- PROCESS-PATH-REGEX,(?i).*Application\\chrome.*,PROXY

- PROCESS-NAME,curl,PROXY
- PROCESS-NAME,chrome.exe,PROXY
- PROCESS-NAME,com.termux,PROXY
- PROCESS-NAME-REGEX,curl$,PROXY
- PROCESS-NAME-REGEX,(?i)Telegram,PROXY
- PROCESS-NAME-REGEX,.*telegram.*,PROXY
- UID,1001,DIRECT

- NETWORK,udp,DIRECT
- DSCP,4,DIRECT

- RULE-SET,providername,proxy
- AND,((DOMAIN,baidu.com),(NETWORK,UDP)),DIRECT
- OR,((NETWORK,UDP),(DOMAIN,baidu.com)),REJECT
- NOT,((DOMAIN,baidu.com)),PROXY
- SUB-RULE,(NETWORK,tcp),sub-rule

- MATCH,auto

docs.title: Priority
docs.text:
Rules will be matched in order from top to bottom, with the rules at the top having higher priority than those below.

If the request is for UDP and the proxy node does not support UDP (for example, if the ss node does not have udp: true specified), it will continue to match downwards.

docs.title: DOMAIN
docs.text: Matches the full domain name.

docs.title: DOMAIN-SUFFIX
docs.text:
Matches the domain suffix.

For example, google.com matches www.google.com, mail.google.com, and google.com, but does not match content-google.com.

docs.title: DOMAIN-KEYWORD
docs.text: Matches using domain keywords.

docs.title: DOMAIN-WILDCARD
docs.text: Wildcard matching, only supports * and ? wildcards.

docs.title: DOMAIN-REGEX
docs.text: Matches using regular expressions for domain names.

docs.title: GEOSITE
docs.text: Matches domains within a Geosite; some content is referenced from v2fly/domain-list-community.

docs.title: IP-CIDR & IP-CIDR6
docs.text: Matches IP address ranges; IP-CIDR and IP-CIDR6 have the same effect, with IP-CIDR6 being an alias.

docs.title: IP-SUFFIX
docs.text: Matches IP suffix ranges.

docs.title: IP-ASN
docs.text: Matches the ASN of the IP.

docs.title: GEOIP
docs.text: Matches the country code of the IP.

docs.title: SRC-GEOIP
docs.text: Matches the country code of the source IP.

docs.title: SRC-IP-ASN
docs.text: Matches the ASN of the source IP.

docs.title: SRC-IP-CIDR
docs.text: Matches the source IP address range.

docs.title: SRC-IP-SUFFIX
docs.text: Matches the source IP suffix range.

docs.title: DST-PORT
docs.text: Matches the target port range of the request.

docs.title: SRC-PORT
docs.text: Matches the source port range of the request.

docs.title: IN-PORT
docs.text: Matches the inbound port, allowing for port ranges.

docs.title: IN-TYPE
docs.text: Matches the inbound type.

docs.title: IN-USER
docs.text: Matches the inbound username, supporting multiple usernames separated by /.

docs.title: IN-NAME
docs.text: Matches the inbound name.

docs.title: PROCESS-PATH
docs.text: Matches using the full process path.

docs.title: PROCESS-PATH-REGEX
docs.text: Matches using regular expressions for the process path.

docs.title: PROCESS-NAME
docs.text: Matches using the process name; on the Android platform, it can match package names.

docs.title: PROCESS-NAME-REGEX
docs.text: Matches using regular expressions for the process name; on the Android platform, it can match package names.

docs.title: UID
docs.text: Matches the Linux USER ID.

docs.title: NETWORK
docs.text: Matches tcp or udp.

docs.title: DSCP
docs.text: Matches the DSCP tag (only for tproxy UDP inbound).

docs.title: RULE-SET
docs.text: References a set of rules; configuration for rule-providers is required.

docs.title: AND & OR & NOT
docs.text:
LOGIC_TYPE,((payload1),(payload2)),Proxy

payload1 and payload2 are rule types and other payloads, such as DOMAIN,google.com.

Logical rules require careful use of parentheses.

docs.title: SUB-RULE
docs.text: Matches to sub-rules; careful use of parentheses is required.

docs.title: MATCH
docs.text: Matches all requests without conditions.

docs.title: no-resolve
docs.text:
Only supports rules regarding the target IP.

When domain matching begins for target IP rules, mihomo will trigger DNS resolution to check if the domain's target IP matches the rules. The no-resolve option can be selected to skip DNS resolution.

If DNS resolution was triggered in an earlier match, it will still match rules regarding target IP that have the no-resolve option added.

docs.title: src
docs.text:
Only supports rules regarding the target IP.

Converts target IP matching to source IP matching.

docs.title: Alpha Branch
docs.text:
Development version with support for new features.

Link

docs.title: Meta Branch
docs.text:
Stable version, updated monthly. Some documentation content may not be released promptly in the meta branch.

Link

docs.title: Quick configuration
docs.text:
GeoXRULE-SETStash(私货) configlink 
# url 里填写自己的订阅,名称不能重复
proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    url: ""
    type: http
    interval: 86400
    health-check: {enable: true,url: "https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204", interval: 300}
    override:
      additional-prefix: "[provider1]"

  provider2:
    url: ""
    type: http
    interval: 86400
    health-check: {enable: true,url: "https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204",interval: 300}
    override:
      additional-prefix: "[provider2]"

proxies: 
  - name: "直连"
    type: direct
    udp: true

mixed-port: 7890
ipv6: true
allow-lan: true
unified-delay: false
tcp-concurrent: true
external-controller: 127.0.0.1:9090
external-ui: ui
external-ui-url: "https://github.com/MetaCubeX/metacubexd/archive/refs/heads/gh-pages.zip"

geodata-mode: true
geox-url:
  geoip: "https://github.com/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat/releases/download/latest/geoip-lite.dat"
  geosite: "https://github.com/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat/releases/download/latest/geosite.dat"
  mmdb: "https://github.com/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat/releases/download/latest/country-lite.mmdb"
  asn: "https://github.com/MetaCubeX/meta-rules-dat/releases/download/latest/GeoLite2-ASN.mmdb"

find-process-mode: strict
global-client-fingerprint: chrome

profile:
  store-selected: true
  store-fake-ip: true

sniffer:
  enable: true
  sniff:
    HTTP:
      ports: [80, 8080-8880]
      override-destination: true
    TLS:
      ports: [443, 8443]
    QUIC:
      ports: [443, 8443]
  skip-domain:
    - "Mijia Cloud"
    - "+.push.apple.com"

tun:
  enable: true
  stack: mixed
  dns-hijack:
    - "any:53"
    - "tcp://any:53"
  auto-route: true
  auto-redirect: true
  auto-detect-interface: true

dns:
  enable: true
  ipv6: true
  enhanced-mode: fake-ip
  fake-ip-filter:
    - "*"
    - "+.lan"
    - "+.local"
    - "+.market.xiaomi.com"
  default-nameserver:
    - tls://223.5.5.5
    - tls://223.6.6.6
  nameserver:
    - https://doh.pub/dns-query
    - https://dns.alidns.com/dns-query

proxy-groups:

  - name: 默认
    type: select
    proxies: [自动选择,直连,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点]

  - name: Google
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: Telegram
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: Twitter
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: 哔哩哔哩
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: 巴哈姆特
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: YouTube
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: NETFLIX
    type: select
    proxies: [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: Spotify
    type: select
    proxies:  [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: Github
    type: select
    proxies:  [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  - name: 国内
    type: select
    proxies:  [直连,默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择]

  - name: 其他
    type: select
    proxies:  [默认,香港,台湾,日本,新加坡,美国,其它地区,全部节点,自动选择,直连]

  #分隔,下面是地区分组
  - name: 香港
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)港|hk|hongkong|hong kong"

  - name: 台湾
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)台|tw|taiwan"

  - name: 日本
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)日|jp|japan"

  - name: 美国
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)美|us|unitedstates|united states"

  - name: 新加坡
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)(新|sg|singapore)"

  - name: 其它地区
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    filter: "(?i)^(?!.*(?:🇭🇰|🇯🇵|🇺🇸|🇸🇬|🇨🇳|港|hk|hongkong|台|tw|taiwan|日|jp|japan|新|sg|singapore|美|us|unitedstates)).*"

  - name: 全部节点
    type: select
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct

  - name: 自动选择
    type: url-test
    include-all: true
    exclude-type: direct
    tolerance: 10

rules:
  - GEOIP,lan,直连,no-resolve
  - GEOSITE,github,Github
  - GEOSITE,twitter,Twitter
  - GEOSITE,youtube,YouTube
  - GEOSITE,google,Google
  - GEOSITE,telegram,Telegram
  - GEOSITE,netflix,NETFLIX
  - GEOSITE,bilibili,哔哩哔哩
  - GEOSITE,bahamut,巴哈姆特
  - GEOSITE,spotify,Spotify
  - GEOSITE,CN,国内
  - GEOSITE,geolocation-!cn,其他

  - GEOIP,google,Google
  - GEOIP,netflix,NETFLIX
  - GEOIP,telegram,Telegram
  - GEOIP,twitter,Twitter
  - GEOIP,CN,国内
  - MATCH,其他

#这里是订阅更新和延迟测试相关的

######### 锚点 end #######

docs.title: Grammar
docs.text:
Mihomo uses yaml as the configuration file format.

yaml is case-sensitive and uses indentation to indicate hierarchical relationships. Tabs are not allowed for indentation; only spaces are permitted. The number of spaces used for indentation is not important, as long as elements at the same level are left-aligned.

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
In yaml formatted files, comments start with "#" and extend to the end of the line. The "#" must be at the beginning of the line or preceded by a space; otherwise, it is not considered a comment.

port: 7890 # HTTP proxy port
socks-port: 7891
# SOCKS proxy port

docs.title: Objects
docs.text:
Key-value pairs in objects are represented using the colon structure key: value, with a space required after the colon. Indentation indicates hierarchical relationships.

Since the yaml format is a superset of json, you can directly use json syntax.

docs.title: Multi-line
docs.text:
tun:
  enable: true
  stack: system
  auto-route: true
  auto-detect-interface: true

docs.title: Multi-line JSON
docs.text:
tun: { 
  enable: true,
  stack: system,
  auto-route: true,
  auto-detect-interface: true
}

docs.title: Single-line JSON
docs.text: tun: { enable: true, stack: system, auto-route: true, auto-detect-interface: true }

docs.title: Full JSON
docs.text:
{
  "tun": {
    "enable": true,
    "stack": "system",
    "auto-route": true,
    "auto-detect-interface": true
  }
}

docs.title: Arrays
docs.text: Lines starting with - indicate the formation of an array, used for multiple values within an object.

docs.title: Multi-line Array
docs.text:
a:
  - b
  - c
  - d

docs.title: Single-line JSON Array
docs.text: a: [b, c, d]

docs.title: References
docs.text:
& is used for anchors and * for aliases, allowing for references. & establishes an anchor, while << indicates merging into the current data, and * is used to reference an anchor.

In the following example, since the key p does not exist in mihomo, it will be ignored during configuration parsing.

If there are duplicate items during merging, they will not be merged.

p: &p
  type: http
  interval: 3600
  health-check:
    enable: true
    url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
    interval: 300

proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    <<: *p
    url: ""
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider1.yaml

  provider2:
    <<: *p
    type: file
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider2.yaml

This is equivalent to:

proxy-providers:
  provider1:
    type: http
    interval: 3600
    health-check:
      enable: true
      url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
      interval: 300
    url: ""
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider1.yaml

  provider2:
    interval: 3600
    health-check:
      enable: true
      url: https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204
      interval: 300
    type: file
    path: ./proxy_providers/provider2.yaml

docs.title: Domain Wildcards
docs.text:
Note

The domain wildcard in this section is not the same as DOMAIN-WILDCARD in the routing rules.

docs.title: Wildcard *
docs.text:
Clash's wildcard * can only match one level of domain at a time.

*.baidu.com matches tieba.baidu.com but does not match 123.tieba.baidu.com or baidu.com.

* only matches hostnames without a . such as localhost.

docs.title: Wildcard +
docs.text:
The wildcard + is similar to DOMAIN-SUFFIX and can match multiple levels at once.

+.baidu.com matches tieba.baidu.com, 123.tieba.baidu.com, and baidu.com.

The wildcard + can only be used for prefix matching of domain names.

docs.title: Wildcard .
docs.text:
The wildcard . can match multiple levels at once.

.baidu.com matches tieba.baidu.com and 123.tieba.baidu.com, but does not match baidu.com.

The wildcard . can only be used for prefix matching of domain names.

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
When using wildcards, you should wrap the content in quotes ' ' or " ".

fake-ip-filter:
- ".lan"
- "xbox.*.microsoft.com"
- "+.xboxlive.com"
- localhost.ptlogin2.qq.com

docs.title: Introducing Domain Sets
docs.text:
Warning

The rule-set only supports behavior as domain/classical.

fake-ip-filter:
- "rule-set:xxx"
- "geosite:xxx"

docs.title: Port Ranges
docs.text: Mihomo can use - to match port ranges, and / or , to separate multiple ports/port ranges.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Match ports 114 to 514 and 810 to 1919, as well as port 65530.

114-514/810-1919,65530

docs.title: Alpha and Meta Branch Differences
docs.text: The Alpha branch is the latest commit branch, while the Meta branch merges the code from the Alpha branch at regular intervals. The Meta branch is not necessarily more stable than the Alpha branch.

docs.title: Which file should I download?
docs.text:
Inrelease, the filename of each package includes several pieces of information, including:

  • Program name (mihomo)
  • Operating system (e.g., android, darwin, freebsd, linux, windows, etc.)
  • Architecture (e.g., 386, amd64, arm32v7, arm64, etc.)
  • Compilation method:
    • v1/2/3: only for AMD64 platforms, used to mark CPU instruction set level
    • default(not specified in file name): Default version compiled with GOAMD64=v3 tag.
    • compatible: Compiled with GOAMD64=v1 tag for compatibility with specific OS or architecture.
    • go120: Compiled with Golang1.20 for compatibility with specific OS or architecture.
    • abi1/2: ABI version for loongarch64, specific details can be found at http://www.loongnix.cn/zh/toolchain/Golang/downloads-Go1.21/index.html
  • Compile branch (e.g., alpha)
  • Git hash value of the commit (e.g., f90066f)

You can choose the executable file you need based on these pieces of information.

Check details between different architectural levels here.

Check details of system compatibility information about Golang version 1.20 here.

For macOS users: According to the Go wiki, Go 1.25 no longer supports macOS 11. macOS 11 users are advised to download the binary with the go124 tag, macOS 10.15 users are advised to download the binary with the go122 tag, and macOS 10.13 users are advised to download the binary with the go120 tag.

For Windows users: Currently, all official builds support Windows 7 and higher. (Unofficial builds are not guaranteed to support this; we maintain our own forked version of Golang for compiling.)

For Linux users: According to the go wiki, Go 1.24 only supports kernels 3.2 and higher. For kernels 2.6.32 to 3.1, please download the binary tagged go123.

Yacd

docs.title: Using systemd
docs.text:
• Download the binary executable file from releases.

  • Rename the downloaded binary executable file to mihomo and move it to /usr/local/bin/.

  • Run Mihomo as a daemon.

Use the following commands to copy the Mihomo binary file to /usr/local/bin and the configuration file to /etc/mihomo:

cp mihomo /usr/local/bin
cp config.yaml /etc/mihomo

Create a systemd configuration file /etc/systemd/system/mihomo.service:

[Unit]
Description=mihomo Daemon, Another Clash Kernel.
After=network.target NetworkManager.service systemd-networkd.service iwd.service

[Service]
Type=simple
LimitNPROC=500
LimitNOFILE=1000000
CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_NET_ADMIN CAP_NET_RAW CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE CAP_SYS_TIME CAP_SYS_PTRACE CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE
AmbientCapabilities=CAP_NET_ADMIN CAP_NET_RAW CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE CAP_SYS_TIME CAP_SYS_PTRACE CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE
Restart=always
ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/sleep 1s
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/mihomo -d /etc/mihomo
ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

Reload systemd using the following command:

systemctl daemon-reload

Enable the Mihomo service:

systemctl enable mihomo

Start Mihomo immediately with the following command:

systemctl start mihomo

Reload Mihomo with the following command:

systemctl reload mihomo

Check the status of Mihomo with the following command:

systemctl status mihomo

Check the running logs of Mihomo with the following command:

journalctl -u mihomo -o cat -e

Or

journalctl -u mihomo -o cat -f

docs.title: Введение
docs.text:
Mihomo это форк открытого проекта Clash с дополнительными уникальными функциями. Эта документация все еще находится в процессе разработки, мы приветствуем ваши PR.

Перед использованием Mihomo, пожалуйста, обратите внимание:

  • Любой проект, не связанный с MetaCubeX, не должен содержать слово mihomo в своем названии.
  • Эта Wiki в основном описывает особенности Mihomo. Для информации о Clash, пожалуйста, смотрите Clash Wiki
  • Эта Wiki основана на последней ветке Mihomo. Если ваша версия Mihomo старше, некоторые функции могут не поддерживаться.
  • Mihomo поддерживает все функции Clash, а также основную часть функций Clash Premium.

docs.title: Пример запроса
docs.text:
Пример curl curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer ${secret}' http://${controller-api}/configs?force=true -d '{"path": "", "payload": ""}' -X PUT

Этот запрос содержит заголовок 'Authorization: Bearer ${secret}', где:

  • ${secret} - ключ api, заданный в конфигурационном файле
  • ${controller-api} - адрес прослушивания api, указанный в конфигурационном файле
  • ?force=true - параметр, который требуется для некоторых запросов
  • '{"path": "", "payload": ""}' - данные обновляемого ресурса

В большинстве случаев передаваемые данные имеют вид '{"path": "", "payload": ""}' и могут содержать путь к новому конфигурационному файлу

!!! note Обратите внимание: если путь не находится в рабочем каталоге Clash, вручную задайте переменную среды SAFE_PATHS, чтобы добавить его в безопасный путь. Синтаксис этой переменной среды совпадает с правилом анализа переменной среды PATH этой операционной системы (то есть он разделяется точкой с запятой в Windows и двоеточием в других системах).
